intro: Pycnosorus, commonly known as the woolly thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and spiny leaves, which provide protection against herbivores. The plant typically grows in temperate regions, often in meadows or along rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually purple or blue, arranged in composite heads that attract pollinators. Pycnosorus species are known for their hardy nature and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
